greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of ordered set partitions of [n] such that for each block b the smallest integer interval containing b has at most k elements; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Column k > 0 is asymptotic to exp(k-1) * n!. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 22 2016
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..42, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, m, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, m!,
mathematica: b[n_, m_, l_List] := b[n, m, l] = If[n == 0, m!, Sum[b[n - 1, Max[m, j], Append[ReplacePart[l, 1 -> Nothing], If[j <= m, 0, j]]], {j, Append[l, m + 1] ~Complement~ {0}}]]; A[n_, k_] := If[k==0, If[n==0, 1, 0], If[k==1, n!, b[n, 0, Array[0&, k-1]]]]; Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 12}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 21 2016
